comments:
First game with Anderson Cooper as guest host.

Champion's winnings & consolation amounts matched to Hospital Albert Schweitzer in Haiti.

clues.clue: Nixon resigned the presidency in a letter to this secy. of state, whose "HK" initials made it effective at 11:35 A.M. on Aug. 9, 1974
After Nixon's resignation, this ABC anchorwoman helped him edit his memoirs
In 1952 Nixon gave a televised address in which he stated he was not giving back his pet with this name
To win the presidency in 1968, Richard Nixon defeated this Democrat
In 1971, Nixon appointed this man to the Supreme Court, 15 years later he was Chief Justice
1968: "I'm sorry, Dave. I'm afraid I can't do that"
2009: "Up ahead was Pandora. You grew up hearing about it, but I never figured I'd be goin' there"
Joaquin Phoenix to Scarlett Johansson: "Are you talking to anyone else right now...? --Yeah. --How many others? --8,316"
1968: "You know what they say, 'Human see, human do'"

clues.answer: The Day the Earth Stood Still
clues.clue: 1951: "I'm worried about Gort. I'm afraid of what he might do if anything should happen to me"
Instead of the deep type of this device, which uses hot oil, try the air type, which uses convection heating
Found between visible light & microwaves on the electromagnetic spectrum, this radiation is used for noncontact thermometers
A mini-fridge with a built-in beer tap is called the this-erator
Now featuring attachments to make pasta & ground meat, the original stand mixer by this brand turned 100 in 2019
French for "under vacuum", this underwater cooking technique is available to home chefs with devices like Anova
"Seek first to understand, then to be understood" is one of this title number of "Habits of Highly Effective People"
The last 2 of the 4 steps for behavior in "Atomic Habits" are response & this "R", which others pair with "Risk"
"The surprising science behind why everything you know about success is (mostly) wrong" is the subtitle of "Barking Up" this
Shhh! Rhonda Byrne told this title to the world in 2006, saying it "is the law of attraction", but let's just keep that between us
This "Eat, Pray, Love" author also offered "Big Magic: Creative Living Beyond Fear"
To speed up quickly, like your car to make that green light
Adjective meaning once every 100 years
Distracted mental state of being in love, like Cher in an Oscar-winning film; snap out of it!

This object is formed by the gradual deposit of calcite
The reading section of the S.A.T. includes 52 questions of this type
M.C. stands for this when referring to Hells Angels
In "The Italian Job" Mark Wahlberg drove this little car as part of a crime caper
You need a license to authorize getting hitched; this other document proves that you entered wedded bliss
George V established this decoration for acts of gallantry against the enemy
The ruins of Pachacamac, an ancient American city later occupied by the Inca, lie just south of this world capital
The ruined city of Vaishali in northeast India is said to be the place where this man preached his last sermon
Now in this country, Persepolis was the capital from which Darius the Great ruled
Lacedaemon was the ancient name for this city on the Evrotas River ruled by a military oligarchy
Now in this Central American country, the ancient Mayan city of Uaxactun was mysteriously abandoned by the 10th century
Tom Clancy left behind detailed notes on this, his most popular hero--dissertation topic, name of his back surgeon...
Jo March has become Mother Bhaer in this 1871 sequel

clues.answer: "It was a dark and stormy night"
clues.clue: "A Wrinkle in Time" starts with what might be called an infamous quotation, these 7 words that also open an 1830 novel
Mega-bestselling author David Baldacci first got the reading bug from books about Freddy, a talking this animal
Bernard Malamud liked writing novels with "The" titles: "The Fixer", "The Assistant" & this one about a baseball star
It's a network of blood vessels or nerves, like the solar one located behind the stomach
At 60, these openings in the iris may be 1/3 the size they were when we were 20, making it harder to adjust to darkness & light
Hair & fingernails are largely made up of this tough protein that also composes an animal's horns & hoofs
The ankle joint is formed by the talus bone articulating with these two bones that go up the leg
The adrenal & pituitary are 2 of the main glands in this system that helps control metabolic activity
Heat index is calculated using this, the measure of water vapor in the atmosphere
This process of supplying agricultural land with water often can involve a system of canals or pipes
This "precipitous" verb means to soak something, like a tea bag, in a liquid long enough so that its flavor is infused
From the Latin for "wash away", it's a word for the flood in the Old Testament
It's the 5-letter word for the lowest internal portion of a ship's hull where water collects
On its website, the ASPCA invites you to take a pledge & stand against this, as in its initials
The WCTU, the Woman's Christian this Union, is still around, educating people on the dangers of alcohol & narcotics
Founded in London in 1961, this group campaigns "for a world where human rights are enjoyed by all"
"Empowering people out of poverty" is one of the missions of this organization, WV for short
In 1998 the American Stroke Association was founded as a division of this other health organization

At this "Baywatch" star's roast, host Seth MacFarlane called him "more than just a terrible actor, he's also a terrible singer"
When Israel hosted this annual music competition in 2019, Bar Refaeli was one of the emcees

final_jeopardy.clue: The New York Times noted "balls of orange-yellow light" & "the town off in the distance" from the artist's window in this piece
